net.cloud.gfx.focus

Interface FocusHandler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ContainerFocusHandler, SingleFocusHandler

    public interface FocusHandler
    This interface defines some object which is capable of dealing with focus. That is, methods for dealing with gaining and losing focus, as well as traversing through other focusable objects. Only one FocusHandler should have focus at once in an application.
    See Also:
    Focusable

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void focusGained()
      Called when this FocusHandler has gained focus.
      void focusLost()
      Called when this FocusHandler no longer has focus.
      Focusable getNext()
      Obtain the next Focusable in the chain.
      Focusable getPrevious()
      Obtain the previous Focusable in the chain.
      boolean hasFocus()
      Check to see if this handler currently has focus
      void setNext(Focusable next)
      Do not call to set up a link.
      void setPrevious(Focusable previous)
      Do not call to set up a link.
      void traverseNext()
      Change focus so that the next handler in line will gain focus and this handler will lose it.
      void traversePrevious()
      Change focus so that the previous handler in line will gain focus and this handler will lose it.

    • Method Detail

      • focusGained

        void focusGained()
        Called when this FocusHandler has gained focus.

      • focusLost

        void focusLost()
        Called when this FocusHandler no longer has focus. (And previously did)

      • traverseNext

        void traverseNext()
        Change focus so that the next handler in line will gain focus and this handler will lose it.

      • traversePrevious

        void traversePrevious()
        Change focus so that the previous handler in line will gain focus and this handler will lose it.

      • hasFocus

        boolean hasFocus()
        Check to see if this handler currently has focus
        Returns:
        True if this handler currently has focus

      • getNext

        Focusable getNext()
        Obtain the next Focusable in the chain. This may return null if there is not one.
        Returns:
        The Focusable which is traversed after this one

      • setNext

        void setNext(Focusable next)
        Do not call to set up a link. Instead use Focusable.linkNext(Focusable)
        Tells this handler that the given Focusable is next in line. Does not set previous.
        Parameters:
        next - The next Focusable in line

      • getPrevious

        Focusable getPrevious()
        Obtain the previous Focusable in the chain. This may return null if there is not one.
        Returns:
        The Focusable which is traversed prior to this one

      • setPrevious

        void setPrevious(Focusable previous)
        Do not call to set up a link. Instead use Focusable.linkPrevious(Focusable)
        Tells this handler that the given Focusable is previous in line. Does not set next.
        Parameters:
        previous - The previous Focusable in line
